title: Hyperlink werkt niet, slotje wel
creator: rbli63
content:
Niet een probleem, maar een vraag.

In een inkomende mail zit een hyperlink. Als ik in gmail (in een browser) daarop klikt, krijg ik een nieuwe tab in de browser met de pagina waar die link naar verwijst.

Thunderbird ziet die link ook, (als ik erover hover verandert de muis in een handje), maar als ik erop klik gebeurt er niets. Rechtsklik -> kopieer link kan wel, maar doet niets. Copy-paste buffer blijft leeg.

Ik heb dit lijstje doorgenomen, geen oorzaak gevonden.

Bij nadere inspectie zag ik rechtsboven het bericht een slotje en een mobieltje. Zie screenshot. Als ik daarop klik, opent de link wel direct in de browser, zowel bij klikken op het slotje als bij klikken op het mobieltje.

Ik kan ermee leven, maar wat is hier precies aan de hand? Disclaimer: ik gebruik Thunderbird sinds gisteren.

title: Google calendar sync is not working
creator: rossi10
content:
That’s not a new bug for me, I’ve been dealing with this one for a few years new, across multiple PCs and Thunderbird installations: from time to time, some of my appointments disappear from Thunderbird calendar. Forcing a synchronization achieves nothing: the appointments are correctly available on google calendar and are missing from Thunderbird.

From time to time I need to unsubscribe from the google calendar, re-subscribe and for a few days everything is fine. Then appointments start to disappear again… rinse and repeat.

Now, I understand it’s impossible to point out what’s going with so little details, and in fact my question really is: what can I do on my side to identify the root cause of this? Are there error logs I can check or other clues that can help with that?

title: Hostinger folders are mapping improperly causing several problems
creator: randall.sulkin
content:
Just started using Thunderbird again, so I do not know how long this has been going on.

I am having several problems I think because Hostinger Email folders are mapping improperly.

1) All folders are showing as nested under the Inbox. Draft, Archive, Sent, one I created, etc. are all nested under the Inbox, rather than being on the same level as the Inbox.

2) In the Unified Inbox, all emails in these nested folders are showing. So all my Archived emails are showing in my Unified Inbox. They are not showing in individual Inboxes, just the Unified.

3) Archiving a message is sending it to my Local Folder, not to the Hostinger account Archive folder.

Any advice would be appreciated.

144.0.1 (64-bit) on Windows 11 Home

title: Transfering Thunderbird from 2014 mini-mac to 2024 mini-mac
creator: jorma12
content: I have used Thunderbird since its inception and keep all my mail history since '07 well organized for each year (archived in local folders for older material and many separate subfolders for various email categories (utilities, credit cards, kids school etc.). I originally attempted Apple's Migration program for transfer but lost all my categories in the process. I went back and made sure I had identical versions of Thunderbird 140.4 on each computer (couldn't get the newest version on my old computer). I followed the directions in the Thunderbird support pages to a 'T' to transfer my profile from the old mac to the new one. The only variation in the directions was the inclusion of the profile within the path of <Mac HD-Users-myname-Library-Thunderbird-Profiles> but the location was the same for both computers. When I returned to my old computer the final time I also lost all of it's organization subfolders. Any help you could offer would be greatly appreciated, because to have to resort what now looks like 1000's of unread emails in my inbox would be impossible to say the least. Thanks in advance for your time and attention. Sincerely, Jack Milne
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.15; rv:144.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/144.0;kb_visits_prior:["/en-US/kb/moving-thunderbird-data-to-a-new-computer"]
